page.title: 07Transport by land
page.content: Transport in our area is mainly by {road}although some{river}and{rail traffic pass through.The rail line is the main Hull-Selby-Leeds line. The road system includes: the main road,the village roads,farm tracks, and paths and bridleways. The{main road}in our area is the{A63 trunk road from Leeds to Hull passing through Selby and Howden.This road carries a lot of traffic from West Yorkshire to Hull docks.Latterly the docks have declined and the extension eastwards of the M62 has led to much east-west heavy traffic using the motorway.Thus our main road is now relatively quiet. The majority of people living in the area use private cars for transport.However there is a local bus service which operates between the villages and Selby each day.
